p:
Finally, it can be noted that optimal control solutions are well known to suffer from low robustness. The same caveat applies here — it may be anticipated that the control parameters
{
u
1
, … ,
u
n
,
t
s 1
, … ,
t
s , n − 1
}
will vary under small changes in the model parameters (for instance, parameter variations within the bounds of the confidence intervals in Appendix A). As such, the optimal control parameters are not expected to be prescriptive. Instead, the general trends in the results are more important — in particular, the importance of suppressing any initial sharp rise in cases, such that high-intensity NPIs can be lifted as soon as possible, with a view to minimizing the economic cost of the suppression strategy.
